setting.primary_location: Orbital Station Nova Prosperity, a corporate-run megastation orbiting Mars, divided into numbered sectors
setting.atmosphere: Gleaming corporate dystopia with dark underbelly, everything is monetized, constant advertising, crushing optimism forced on workers, 'smile or be fired' culture in official spaces vs. exhausted despair in residential sectors

technology_level.general: Advanced but deliberately withheld - tech exists to eliminate scarcity but is gated behind paywalls and corporate ownership
technology_level.automation: Most manufacturing and service jobs could be automated but aren't - keeping humans employed in terrible jobs is corporate policy to maintain control
technology_level.surveillance: Everything is tracked for 'productivity metrics' - work output, spending habits, social media sentiment. Citizens have 'prosperity scores' that affect access to services.
technology_level.currency: Station Credits (SC) - digital only, all transactions monitored. Black market uses barter and physical goods.
technology_level.medical: Tiered healthcare based on employment and prosperity score - executives get nanotech healing, workers get basic care, unemployed get nothing

social_structures.sector_system: Station divided into 50 numbered sectors. Lower numbers (1-10) are executive and elite, mid-numbers (11-35) are worker residential and commercial, high numbers (36-50) are industrial slums and poor residential. Sector 12 is industrial/working class.
social_structures.employment: Work is mandatory - unemployment beyond 60 days results in 'labor reassignment' to worst jobs. Everything is gig economy with no benefits. Citizens have multiple jobs to survive.
social_structures.corporate_governance: Station is owned and run by Prosperity Collective Inc. - a megacorp that positions itself as benevolent. The Board is effectively the government. Elections are theater.
social_structures.prosperity_score: Algorithm-generated score based on employment, spending, debt, social connections. Affects housing, healthcare, even food quality. Climbing the score is nearly impossible for lower sectors.
social_structures.drugs: Leveler - synthetic drug that reduces anxiety and increases compliance, originally developed as antidepressant. Highly addictive. Black market cutting makes it dangerous. Workers take it to handle multiple jobs and constant stress.

economic_rules.everything_costs: Literally everything - air quality above baseline costs extra, water beyond rations costs, education, healthcare, even grief counseling after workplace deaths has a fee
economic_rules.debt_spiral: Designed to keep workers in debt - high-interest loans for everything, hidden fees, 'prosperity improvement' charges
economic_rules.corporate_scrip: Many workers paid partially in sector-specific scrip only usable at company stores, trapping them in exploitation loop
economic_rules.black_market: Thriving underground economy trading goods and services outside corporate monitoring

corporate_propaganda.language: Everything is rebranded - no 'poor people', only 'pre-prosperous citizens'; no 'exploitation', only 'opportunity for growth'; no 'death', only 'early resource reallocation'
corporate_propaganda.media: Constant corporate media about 'Nova Prosperity Dream' - work hard and prosper. Every sector has mandatory motivational broadcasts.
corporate_propaganda.mandatory_optimism: Expressing negativity about the station or Prosperity Collective in public or online can lower your prosperity score or result in 'wellness intervention'

world_physics.gravity: Perfect artificial gravity throughout - this is a 'premier' station
world_physics.atmosphere: Climate controlled but tiered - executive sectors are perfect, worker sectors are adequate, slum sectors are barely maintained
world_physics.architecture: Corporate modernist - lots of glass and steel, everything looks clean and efficient on surface, hiding the exploitation beneath

themes: What happens when you remove scarcity from one group?
Are people inherently lazy or just ground down by survival?
Can individual action expose systemic flaws?
The difference between charity and solidarity
tone: Darkly satirical with moments of genuine warmth, absurdist corporate-speak contrasted with human connection, tragic-comic, biting social commentary wrapped in character-driven story
